title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 February 2015 - XWiki
content:

00:47 <kyndel> how do i make a paragraph blue in xwiki syntax 2.0? i've got the (% style="color:blue" %) part, but that only applies to a single line. how do i specifiy when to stop being blue?

10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> are we supposed to support importing PDFs with OO?  
10:09 <vmassol> I mean do we have that in the UI?  
10:09 <tmortagne> I don't think so  
10:10 <tmortagne> hmm not so sure actually  
10:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <vmassol> xwiki SAS seems to do it: http://www.xwiki.com/lang/en/Offer/DataImports ;)  
10:12 <vmassol> someone asked here but no answer: http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/PDF-import-via-office-importer-which-versions-work-td7589652.html  
10:12 <tmortagne> thing is our import UI does not really indicate what input is supported, you give a file and it will work or not  
10:12 <vmassol> ok that probably explains it  
10:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <vrachieru> has quit  
10:51 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <gsmeria> has quit

11:16 <tmortagne> guys, some inputs on "So what is an extension flavor exactly ?" mail would be welcome

13:47 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <Enygma`> vmassol: any idea about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/CommentAsGuestTest/initializationError/ ? Any refactorings done in that area recently?  
13:52 <vmassol> ah yes it's me  
13:52 <vmassol> fixing it  
13:53 <gsmeria> has quit  
13:53 <Enygma`> thanks  
13:56 <Enygma`> mflorea1: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/WizardTest/testCreateApplication/ seems to be have started failing since http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/582/ with your handling of XWIKI-11747  
13:56 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <Enygma`> vmassol: we have a lot of test failures due to the new no-logging in tests rule. Example: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-activeinstalls-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.activeinstalls.test.ui/ActiveInstallsTest/org\_xwiki\_activeinstalls\_test\_ui\_ActiveInstallsTest/  
13:58 <Enygma`> 27 tests failing this rule: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastBuild/testReport/  
13:59 <Enygma`> what should we do about them for the release on monday?  
13:59 <Enygma`> best effort to fix them, but no blocker?  
14:00 <Enygma`> this is an example where I can not easily tell if it is a logging problem or a test problem: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/lastBuild/org.xwiki.rendering$xwiki-rendering-transformation-linkchecker/testReport/org.xwiki.rendering.internal.transformation.linkchecker/DefaultHTTPCheckerTest/org\_xwiki\_rendering\_internal\_transformation\_linkchecker\_DefaultHTTPCheckerTest/  
14:01 <Enygma`> how is the rule implemented? Does it check if the test already failed? Because if it is already failed, it should not touch it since it would otherwise make life harder to debug/distinguish the cause.  
14:05 <vmassol> Enygma`: they need to be fixed. I would have fixed them if I had seen them  
14:06 <vmassol> the problem is that ci.xwiki.org is fialing all the time for me  
14:06 <vmassol> I didn't realize they would fail for fnuc tests, fixing  
14:08 <vmassol> I'm having a hard time reproducing http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/org.xwiki.rendering$xwiki-rendering-transformation-linkchecker/171/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.rendering.internal.transformation.linkchecker/DefaultHTTPCheckerTest/org\_xwiki\_rendering\_internal\_transformation\_linkchecker\_DefaultHTTPCheckerTest/ Does it fail for you Enygma`?  
14:11 <Enygma`> did not try yet, let me see  
14:18 <Enygma`> vmassol: can`t reproduce locally  
14:18 <vmassol> the problem is that I know why it's failing  
14:18 <vmassol> kind of  
14:18 <vmassol> and I've already committed 2 changes to fix it  
14:19 <vmassol> it's indirectly caused by thomas's change  
14:19 <vmassol> when he changed the MockitoCompnentMockingRule  
14:19 <vmassol> to not mock Provider any more  
14:19 <vmassol> and thus the Provider is now looking for an ObservationManager component  
14:19 <vmassol> whereas before the code had a check on null...  
14:20 <vmassol> this is why I committed the 2 changes but I must have missed it somewehre but can't figure out where rightn ow  
14:20 <vmassol> fixing the func tests right now  
14:20 <vmassol> I'll look at this after  
14:25 <Enygma`> ok, but what about the logging rule, can we make it not throw an AssertionError if the test is already failed at the point when the log output is checked?  
14:25 <Enygma`> so that it does not unnecessarily pollute the failed test's messages?  
14:26 <vmassol> yes I'll do that  
14:26 <vmassol> I'm modifying the capture listener already right now  
14:26 <vmassol> so i'll include that as well  
14:28 <Enygma`> cool  
14:29 <mflorea1> Enygma`: re AWM test, I reported http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11770  
14:30 <mflorea1> we either fix this issue or I will update AWM to use HQL (not nice but ok since that query is not complex)  
14:31 <mflorea1> I guess we need to update the XWQL grammar  
14:31 <mflorea1> or something like that  
14:31 <mflorea1> to support Unicode in doc(XXX)  
14:31 <mflorea1> I mean doc.object(XXX)  
14:33 <mflorea1> I'm surprised no one has hit this issue before. I guess we don't create xclasses with Unicode chars in their name that often, but with AWM this is highly possible  
14:35 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <Enygma`> +1 to use HQL in AWM and then probably revert it when XWIKI-11770 is fixed  
15:13 <vmassol> Enygma`: done for what you were asking for, see commit just above  
15:13 <vmassol> now updating rendering and platform  
15:13 <vmassol> then i'll work on the func tests  
15:16 <Enygma`> cool  
15:17 <Enygma`> also, much simpler to use a property to skip the test :)  
15:17 <vmassol> yup  
15:17 <Enygma`> though we should not use it at all :P  
15:17 <vmassol> not that we want to encourage this ;)  
15:17 <Enygma`> right :)  
15:17 <vmassol> but I need this for the func tests  
15:17 <vmassol> for which I think it's ok  
15:18 <vmassol> but I'll need to think more about it...  
15:18 <vmassol> hmm rendering fails locally  
15:19 <vmassol>   ResourceReferenceTest.testToString:46 expected:<... Parameters = [[name[1] = [value1], [name2] = [value2]]]> but was:<... Parameters = [[name[2] = [value2], [name1] = [value1]]]>  
15:19 <vmassol> checking  
15:19 <vmassol> someone has been nasty  
15:19 <vmassol> :)  
15:20 <vmassol> I'm the only one to have touched this test though ;)  
15:20 <vmassol> ok fixing  
15:20 <vmassol> it's really strange that it didn't fail before  
15:27 <vmassol> oh I know  
15:27 <vmassol> it's because I've switched to java8  
15:27 <vmassol> just found another flickering test
